Charon

Charon are the stewards of souls in Marlien, and part of a larger order of Soul Stewards which preside over all of Creation. They may be divided into a number of castes, some of which are incarnations of Divine Atman bound to Marlien, while others are mortal compositions of atman and anicca. They all reside together in the The Halls of the Charon.

Castes of Charon

Immortals

The immortals are the original Soul Stewards from beyond Marlien who were tethered to it, and now serve as the leaders of all charon. Though they are not forced to assume a physical form within this world, that which they are able to assume was dictated by the Dead Gods. Because the fission of the Arbiter and the Second dead gods of Marlien bombarded the Girdle with such great quantities of mana, the charon are unable to prematurely destroy it, and are locked within it with the souls they seek to protect, until the end of time.

Yamaraj

The Yamaraj are the grave magistrates and final judges of mortal souls arriving at the The Halls of the Charon. They are treated with reverence by all residents of the halls, each having their own temple-like adobe, and a grand altar upon which to accept audiences. Though detached, they are known to take interest in the activities of mortals, each having its own peculiar preference.

Yamaraj also occasionally meet council halls built to accommodate their giant forms, or accept audiences as a group in such chambers.

Apearance

Like giant, four-legged dragons with a coat of black feathears, and the head of a crow.

Mortals

The mortal races of the charon were created by the immortals to bolster their number, serving as their agents and footsoldiers accross Marlien. Most were created by imbuing creatures taken from the Planes with something of the immortals' nature. This process forever alters the mortal soul, and so is considered a desparate measure; the souls of mortal charon are only ever reincarnated in other charon, and it is rare that more are ever created. Though the immortals are capable of manifesting new physical bodies of anicca and mana, most mortal charon are also capable of biological reproduction - some even retain the sexual compatability of the progenitor species.

Memitim

Memitim are the legionnaires of the Charon, questing into the mortal realms to find newly freed souls before a fate worse than death consumes them, and there face off against the grasping things of The Astral Plane which congregate about, until the soul drifts naturally toward, or can be safely guided to The Everstair.

Though bred from human stock, and resembling them more closely than most castes of the Charon, the gaze of a Memitim is believed to drive men of most mortal races mad, and perhaps do irreparable damage to their soul. Therefore, they wear masks, or full helmets when they venture into mortal realms.

Shoki

Shoki are the shepherds, counsellors, and wranglers of lingering souls, and one of the only human-like charon gifted with a bare-faced visage that will not immediately drive a mortal to madness - though the rest of their form seems to be in mockery of this. They wander the lands of mortals hunched staves, laden with baggage which is, on closer inspection, largely empty, used only to cover their spiral shell. There they seek out wayward and stubborn souls which have somehow escaped the grasping claws of The Astral Plane.

Vanth

While the Memitim are in the The Halls of the Charon they are expected to relax from combat duties, though they maintain other duties to the Immortals. In the The Halls of the Charon, therefore, it is instead the role of the tireless Vanth to ward off would-be intruders. Vanth are frightening to behold and considered inferior to the legions of Memitim, so are only generally taken abroad when great numbers are required for a battle or intervention, or when a single Memitim or Shoki requires bodyguards.

Appearance

Monsterous, bird-like humanoids.

Nosoi

The avian Nosoi are messengers for the Charon and counsellors for departed souls.

Charon in Other Cultures

Haleysi, Agyanism

Some images and textual references to the charon were passed down through the Warelin people to the Haleysi and other Agyanist folk around the The North Sea of Paraesi, who name them Extinguishers for their role in the destruction of the Graadien and Darohl peoples in the Arcane Holocaust, along with their vast stores of knowledge and technologies.

Arthale, Solenism

Some images and textual references to the charon were passed down through the Warelin people to the western folk of the Arthalean Empire and their inheritors. Here they are seen as agents of the beast, Erasors, and enemies of Solen for their role in the destruction of the Graadien and Darohl peoples in the Arcane Holocaust, along with their vast stores of knowledge and technologies.
